subject: Re: Mortgage Direct calculators : Embedding code and guide

full_threads.body:
Hi Joel

That works so much better, really appreciate your assistance

Best regards

Jo Carroll | Client Services Director | Mortgage Directt +61 2 9302 0588 m 0418 700 755 toll free 1300 360 999
Level 33, MLC Building, 19 Martin Place Sydney NSW 2000

Hi Jo,

Sure, we have breakdown the calculators into separate pages. 
https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/calculators/

https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/calculators/how-much-can-i-borrow/
https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/calculators/loan-repayments/
https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/calculators/extra-repayments/
https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/calculators/lump-sum/
https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/calculators/stamp-duty/
https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/calculators/salary-and-income-tax-calculator/

Let me know if this works for you? Cheers!

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
@joel I can talk you through this one : )

It’s an easy one.

FYI


From: Kang Wang | VisionAbacus.net <http://visionabacus.net/> <kang.wang@visionabacus.net <mailto:kang.wang@visionabacus.net>>
Sent: Wednesday, 23 October 2019 9:46 AM
To: Jo Carroll <jo.carroll@mortgagedirect.com.au <mailto:jo.carroll@mortgagedirect.com.au>>
Subject: RE: Embedding code and guide

Hi, Jo

The following email is the embedding guide I sent to you when we set up your calculators. It clearly state thatdon’t add all calculator on one page, don’t use tab or accordion (see item1)

But your web designers completely ignore our guide and warning, they add all calculators on one page and use an accordion component on your web page. This is worst embedding for performance and waste your and our resource.

A good sample for embedding is to create an index page or menu then one web page only embed one calculator like this
https://www.homeloanexperts.com.au/home-loan-articles/refinance-home-loan <https://www.homeloanexperts.com.au/home-loan-articles/refinance-home-loan>
http://linkmortgageservices.com.au/useful-tools <http://linkmortgageservices.com.au/useful-tools>

Kang

From: Kang Wang || VisionAbacus <kang.wang@visionabacus.net <mailto:kang.wang@visionabacus.net>>
Sent: Wednesday, 13 September 2017 10:28 AM
To: 'Jo Carroll' <jo.carroll@mortgagedirect.com.au <mailto:jo.carroll@mortgagedirect.com.au>>
Cc: 'Kang Wang | VisionAbacus ' <Kang.Wang@visionabacus.com <mailto:Kang.Wang@visionabacus.com>>
Subject: Embedding code and guide

Hi, Jo

The attachments are CSS code and iframe code for your web designers. You can forward it to your web designers. They just need to copy and paste code and insert it into your web pages without writing extra code.
We can help if they have any problem.

The full list of calculators is here
https://www.visionabacus.net/ACalcList/MortgageDirect <https://www.visionabacus.net/ACalcList/MortgageDirect>

The following is a brief guide on embedding:

1) Your web designers need to create an index page and one web page only embeds one calculator. It isn't good practice to embed all or multiple calculators on one web page.
They shouldn't use javascript tab or accordion to embed multiple calculators on one page.

2) Upload CSS file to your web server and all calculator pages should link to it.

3) Each calculator just needs one line iframe code to be inserted. The iframe code can be found in attachment.

4) If you need a loading spinner when a calculator is being loaded and rendered. Your web designers can download a loading spinner image gif from internet, upload it to your server.
Change the gif file path in the second line of CSS code.

5)On mobile, it's better to remove space between left and right of the calculators such that the left and right border of calculators touch the screen border. This is good for small screen and old mobile.

If your web designers have any problem about embedding, they can send us the calculator url to us, we can debug for them.

Thanks

Kang

Kang Wang
VisionAbacus Pty Ltd
(02) 9829 3178
Kang.Wang@VisionAbacus.com <mailto:Kang.Wang@VisionAbacus.com>

==========================================================================================

The following is a brief explanation of CSS code if your web designer needs to modify the code.

CSS code for responsive design

1) The purple part is to set default width and height for calculators if the ID is not found

2)the green part is for desktop and set height for each calculator for desktop to overwrite default height.

3)the blue part is for mobile and set height to overwrite default height.

CSS code
===================================================

.VisiCalcClass {
background:url(/staticAssets/calculators/load.gif) 50% 15% no-repeat;
background-size: 80px 80px;
min-width: 750px;
min-height:800px;
margin:0;
padding:0;
}

#Loan_Repayment_Calculator { min-height:750px !important; }
#Borrowing_Power_Calculator { min-height:750px !important; }
#Budget_Planner { min-height:2850px !important; }
#Compound_Interest_Calculator { min-height:850px !important; }
#Credit_Card_Calculator { min-height:900px !important; }
#How_Long_to_Repay_Calculator { min-height:750px !important; }
#Interest_Only_Mortgage_Calculator { min-height:750px !important; }
#Saving_Calculator { min-height:600px !important; }
#Split_Loan_Calculator { min-height:800px !important; }
#Property_Selling_Cost_Calculator { min-height:700px !important; }
#Reverse_Mortgage_Calculator { min-height:1100px !important; }
#Stamp_Duty_Calculator { min-height:800px !important; }

@media screen and (max-width: 767px) {
.VisiCalcClass {
min-width: 100%;
min-height:1250px;
margin:0;
padding:0;}
#Loan_Repayment_Calculator { min-height:1250px !important; }
#Borrowing_Power_Calculator { min-height:1800px !important; }
#Budget_Planner { min-height:5000px !important; }
#Comparison_Rate_Calculator { min-height:1450px !important; }
#Compound_Interest_Calculator { min-height:1200px !important; }
#Credit_Card_Calculator { min-height:1500px !important; }
#Extra_Repayment_Calculator { min-height:1450px !important; }
#Home_Loan_Offset_Calculator{ min-height:1400px !important; }
#How_Long_to_Repay_Calculator { min-height:1250px !important; }
#Interest_Only_Mortgage_Calculator { min-height:1450px !important; }
#Saving_Calculator { min-height:1250px !important; }
#Introductory_Rate_Loan_Calculator{ min-height:1400px !important; }
#Lump_Sum_Repayment_Calculator { min-height:1450px !important; }
#Split_Loan_Calculator { min-height:1550px !important; }
#Loan_Comparison_Calculator { min-height:1800px !important; }
#Property_Buying_Cost_Calculator { min-height:1850px !important; }
#Property_Selling_Cost_Calculator { min-height:1650px !important; }
#Reverse_Mortgage_Calculator { min-height:1900px !important; }
#Stamp_Duty_Calculator { min-height:1250px !important; }
}
}
